snippet: Russian media reported that the student feared returning to Russia because he could face persecution over his sexuality.
abstract: Russia pulls out of longstanding American high-school exchange program called Future Leaders Exchange after teenage Russian boy who befriended a gay couple decided to seek asylum in the United States on grounds he would face persecution over his sexual orientation; Konstantin Dolgov, top Foreign Ministry official for human rights, says program clearly states that all Russian children must return home.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from Moscow, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington. Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Russian media reported that the student feared returning to Russia because he could face persecution over his sexuality.

headline.main: Russia Cancels Exchange Program After a Student Seeks U.S. Asylum
headline.print_headline: Russia Cancels Exchange Program After a Student Seeks U.S. Asylum
